main event: An unidentified object, described as a bright greenish-white flare that burst into two orange flares, was observed descending from an MATS 4 flight in the Pacific Ocean on May 17, 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed for 10 seconds, with a downward progression.
The report includes several possible explanations, including a balloon, meteor, aircraft, or unidentified flying object.
The description of the object as a flare is noted as conforming with the analysis.
The report was distributed to various military and intelligence agencies, including the Air Force, Navy, and Defense Intelligence Agency.
The report includes coordinates for the location of the observation, 46-13N 173-53W, which is in the Pacific Ocean.
sighted object: bright greenish-white flare that burst into two orange flares
